title: It sure doesn't feel like Riot wants you to climb in ranked
body:
This is very apparent when they encourage competitive League Of Legends like it's the second coming of Christ. ESPECIALLY the LCS advertisement no one asks for. (Really, no one actually cares until Worlds) 

You get on a winstreak, and suddenly you're matched with pretty much only other high winstreak players, but THE MOMENT you guys lose, you get placed with other players who are losing their games. Then, you get stuck in that cycle of suffering and pain until you actually win again. Riot has intentionally made it so that even if you lose ONCE you're going to suffer 4 hours later.

From what I've witnessed from each respective elo from variety of players (Whether it's extremely low Elo players who can't do anything right or Pro players who seem to be good at everything) have experienced this load of horse radish. 

I've seen mid master players drop to D1 because of this stupid crap happening to them. 

Also, from my own personal experience (I'm not that good at the game, I know already) it's happened to me as well. I'm not even tilted and I get continuous losses


EDIT: I also wanted to say, Ranked has created a false hierarchy and superiority complex across all Elos that are higher than another. People legitimately think they're better than someone because they pressed buttons better than the other person in a non-existent reality.

You can be in challenger but have Platinum MMR or be Platinum with Challenger MMR.

That is, what decides matchmaking, not your LP
Why does the rank system exist, then?

To make you feel better and for it to be more tangible, that's literally the only reason and Riot has said as much. "Platinum 3" sounds more tangible than say "2378 MMR" and it's way easier to understand. If I say "3000 MMR", how do you know if that's good or bad? I'd have to tell you the scale as well for you to have any reference. But if I say "I'm diamond rank" that immediately tells you I'm pretty good, because diamonds are pretty valuable in real life.

but that's a matter of human social construct, not of what's **actual, genuine and true.** You can be Diamond with Bronze MMR, or you can be SIlver with Gold MMR. The system's meaningless to anyone involved for the reason "3,000 MMR" is meaningless to anyone who isn't: a lack of context.

K/DA has nothing to do with the game's outcome. A System couldn't tell if you did well because you were 4/10/30.
Too many factors involved, like dying for a shutdown gold or securing drake, baron, inhib... stuff like that. K/DA basically only matters if you're trying to stack Darkseal...

A positive KDA means you feed less gold to the enemy team. A negative KDA means you feed more gold to the enemy team. I'm sure you'd rather have my 13/5/12 Ahri over someone elses' 5/10/10. Even then, a performance-oriented system a' la' CS:GO would include stuff like objectives and ganks and wards and all that jazz and compare it to the average of a rank. If you're sub-par, you gain less for a win and lose more for a loss. If you're above-par, you gain more and lose less. They've already proven it possible with their champion analysis and ranking, where you get an S+ if you're the only one doing jack on the team.

I've smurfed and I know that there are a lot of games where you cant win no matter how good you do but I gotta say that its hard to believe that you would have problems climbing out of G4 if you really had a ''alt acc in plat 1''

I'm done with SR ranked in general until something changes.  Its just not worth the stress.

Especially watching two of my friends -- who will readily admit I'm a vastly better player than they are -- rank higher than me.

I just have terrible luck with AFKs and shit.  Seems like it just follows me around.

I stream occasionally and I've even had viewers comment on it.  Its absolutely outrageous how many games I lose because someone goes AFK, or I get something like a 0-14 inting mid laner.

I'll do ranked when its an actual reflection of my skill, and not a reflection of how lucky I got with competent/participating team mates.

TFT ranked is more fun.  I've got nobody to blame but myself if I win or lose.  Its my own decisions and my own skill that decide the game -- and I think that's a much more rewarding experience.

I'm also damn near platinum in the first few weeks, and still climbing rapidly.
Jesus christ lol. If you're good enough, you can literally win 4v5s in silver. But hey, better blame the system because I'm just not good enough to climb haha.

I literally said in my post that I'm not good enough.

Weird flex, but ok.
Then why are you complaining about not the ladder being luck based?? Jesus fuck lol.

In any given SR game, I have 4 chances to have someone on my team that's going to int, feed, actively troll, or disconnect.
I also have 5 chances on the enemy team to have a diamond+ smurf streaming his "Bronze to Diamond" stream.

I am not good enough to beat these things, and so I don't enjoy it.

In TFT, none of that matters.  All that matters is how I play and what I do with the cards I'm dealt.  People can troll all they want, it only ever benefits me.  People can disconnect all they want, it only benefits me.  People can run stupid ass comps for the luls and I don't care, it only benefits me.

I'm nearly platinum and still gaining 60+ LP for first place victories, and only losing 15-30 for 5th place and below.  Climbing rapidly.

It feels good to have an expression of my own skill instead of being at the mercy of the team mates and opponents I'm given.

OP.GG has this thing called "ACE" and "MVP" on their stats readouts.  Means you were the best player on the team statistically.  MVP if you won.  ACE if you lost.  When I get serious about ranked, my stats are MVP ACE ACE ACE MVP ACE MVP ACE ACE ACE ACE.

But none of that matters.  It doesn't matter that I was the best player on my team.  I can go 30-0 and get 8 towers by myself (exaggeration, obviously), but it doesn't matter if one of my team mates goes AFK or starts actively trying to lose because they got mad about something.  I go down with the ship.  Period.

That doesn't feel good.  That feels the opposite of good.

I'm sorry it bothers you that I don't enjoy the system.
Believe it or not, its ok that we don't like the same things or agree.  You can still be you, and I can still be me.

That op.gg stat does not matter.

You have 5 chances for someone on the enemy team to int your team and win you the game too btw.

Yes, and it probably feels really bad for them, too.  My enemies having an equal chance at not having fun doesn't increase my chances of having fun.

I don't like winning against AFKs or trolls any more than I like losing to them.

Players should be judged based on their individual skill as well as their contributions to their team -- not whether or not someone threw a temper tantrum and threw the game on purpose.

I don't know why this is such an inflammatory thing for you -- you've been in games where this has happened to you.  You didn't enjoy it.  Its not fun.  You got mad about it, and you thought to yourself "I should have won that, but one single player decided the outcome of the game, and that's not fair."

Everyone has been through this.  From Iron to Challenger.

Congrats on being a better player than me?  Do you want me to say I'm proud of you?  Like... I don't know what you're looking for here.

That kind of outcome to a game isn't fun for me, and it happens way too much for me to enjoy playing ranked on SR.

That shit doesn't happen in TFT.  I enjoy TFT.  I'm gonna play TFT.

When i got on losing streaks its usually 20 games in a row.

No matter what i do or play i always end up losing to the point i end up taking months break to forget all about it

I agree. The problem also seems to stem from the fact that you can go 15-0-10 or something and gain 18-20 LP. Then lose where you are the only one on your team positive, or even remotely useful. And lose just as much. 
Another problem I see is the favoring those who play an obscene amount. This is caused by promos getting easier every time you reach them, as well as the way wibstreaking works, if you get carried a couple times in a row you are more likely to be put on teams able to carry you.

My solution, make Sr gains losses a much wider range 5-35 and almost entirely dependent on performance. With slants towards things like objective takes. (With markers on champs/roles to whichobj you should be helping with.
For example. If support goes and helps take Herald at 13 min but ADC either dies and gives up bot tower or has to back off and give up bot tower. That should be a net loss for support. But if say top does a similar play and sacrifices some or all of top tower to take Herald and take mid that should be positive as that's overall better for the team (mid tower allows better map control)
Similarly split push champs gain Sr equity when they take side lane towers (more if they do it without losing another obj on map) but an ADC or teamfight control mage should lose Sr equity  if they trade major obj. Obviously they gain if the take without losing anything as well. 

Tldr

Remove promos and make LP the only determiner for not only ranks, but also matchmaking. Fuck hidden MMR it's actually bullshit. 

Make it a whole lot easier to clime if you pop off every game, make it alot easier to tank if you are carried. Encourage grouping on champs meant to group and splitting on champs suited to splitting.

Their matchmaking system needs a revamp. But then, they can't figure out how to balance champs so I guess we shouldn't expect much balance in the rest of the game.

Riot doesn't want you to climb.
They also don't want you to fall.
Nor do they want you to stay where you are.

They want you to be at the elo and mmr that equates to your actual skill level.

All these conspiracle ideas about the system making you go on lose streaks is just nonsense.
Your skill level is X. You won some matches. You're mmr and elo rose to X+Y. You are now in matches you aren't skilled enough for. You lose.
"But this teammate of mine is a different rank than me." Yea. And his mmr is the same as yours. Or at the very least, he was the closest to you available, and the matchmaker decided you should't have to wait too long for someone closer.

I can 100% agree with this comment! Everyday I check my OP.GG and LolSumo apps to see my progress and just about every game I'm playing at a Gold-Plat level of play, yet I'm always stuck with losing and feeding and toxic teams! At one point I was S2 in promos to go to S1 and the within the week I drop to S4. Now I've been hard stuck S4 for the past month and theres nothing I can do about it because I'm stuck with feeders every other game! All I'm saying is if I'm Silver, there should be Silver level players on my team, not bronze or iron. This NEEDS to be fixed! 

Also, LP needs to be fixed aswell. I lose twice as much LP as I gain, its not fair to gain 12-14 on a win but lose 20-22 on a loss, its LITERALLY IMPOSSIBLE to climb. There are many other things I believe should be fixed aswell, such as: DNC within first 5 minutes should allow you to remake, if someone is obviously feeding they should lose more LP than those trying, autofilled games shouldn't be counted as full LP games for when you lose, etc. But the main one was, I 100% AGREE, is the matchmaking FOR SURE.
To climb you have to be better than your opponent AND get lucky that one of your teammates deaths aren't in the double digits...

I have opened many tickets with Riot on this subject. Even while on winning streaks and clawing my way out of Gold 4 I was instantly placed with Bronze 4 players when I hit Gold 3, not only that they had a less than 40% win rating. Regardless of how consistently you play the game will match you with a faster match instead of a more balanced one.

"We greatly appreciate your feedback. I know that it is frustrating to have unmatched matches. Especially if you’re already in a higher rank. It’s great to see everyone to be around your skill level.

However, as much as we would love to give you an experience like that, we would not want you to wait forever to get into a match. So, our matchmaking system has to broaden its search for players. That being said, it does not compromise on the fairness of the match." - Dizzy Dino, Riot Support

The only way around this is to have some sort of social media presence or be a content creator so they will give you priority placement in matches. If you don't give them additional funding through your videos they do not care about you or your climb.

I found a way to overcome this thing. I call it the 2 game rule. Basically you play until you lose 2 games in a row. If you get to the point when you are losing 2 games in a row you take a about a hour break, you can play normals if you want. After the break play again until you lose 2 games in a row.If you need proof that it works take me: i've been a gold player since season 5 i dont watch guides and stuff so everything i know its from practice, but i could not climb out of gold, until i used this trick and got to plat so easy it blew my mind. This season i quited the game for a while and when i came back my pc broke so i only got to g1 but when ill fix my pc ill easily get to plat and next season for sure ill get to diamond.
